action.action-desc: Mr. Curbelo of Florida (for himself and Ms. Velázquez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To exempt health insurance of residents of United States territories from the annual fee on health insurance providers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Territory Health Insurance Tax Relief Act of 2017.

section.header: Health insurance of residents of United States territories exempt from annual fee on health insurance providers

subsection.text: Section 9010(b) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (26 U.S.C. subtitle D front matter note) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Exception for health insurance of residents of United States territories

subparagraph.text: Solely for purposes of paragraph (1)(A), the term United States health risk shall not include the health risk of any individual who is a bona fide resident of Guam, American Samoa, the Northern Mariana Islands, Puerto Rico, or the Virgin Islands (as determined under section 937(a)).

subparagraph.header: Exception not to increase fee allocation
subparagraph.text: The amount determined under paragraph (1)(B) shall be determined without regard to subparagraph (A) of this paragraph.

subsection.text: Section 9010(g)(1) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (26 U.S.C. subtitle D front matter note) is amended by inserting (and the amount of such net premiums to which subsection (b)(4)(A) applies) before the period at the end.

paragraph.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to calendar years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.

For purposes of applying the amendment made by subsection (a) with respect to the first calendar year beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretaryâ€™s designee) shall provide a method for covered entities to report the information described in the amendment made by subsection (b) for the calendar year which precedes such first calendar year.
